question_text: How many tangents can a circle have?
correct_answer: A circle has infinitely many tangents because at each point on the circle there is exactly one tangent.
explanation: A tangent to a circle touches it at exactly one point. Since there are infinitely many points on a circle, each with its unique tangent, a circle can have infinitely many tangents.

question_text:
Fill in the blanks:
(i) A tangent to a circle intersects it in ______ point(s).
(ii) A line intersecting a circle in two points is called a ______.
(iii) A circle can have ______ parallel tangents at the most.
(iv) The common point of a tangent to a circle and the circle is called ______.
correct_answer: (i) one, (ii) secant, (iii) two, (iv) point of contact
explanation: A tangent touches a circle at exactly one point. A line intersecting a circle at two distinct points is known as a secant. As shown in the activity, only two tangents can be drawn parallel to a given secant at most. The point where a tangent touches the circle is called the point of contact.

question_text: A tangent PQ at a point P of a circle of radius 5 cm meets a line through the centre O at a point Q so that OQ = 12 cm. Length PQ is:
explanation: Since PQ is a tangent at P, the radius OP is perpendicular to the tangent by Theorem 10.1. Therefore, triangle OPQ is right-angled at P with OP = 5 cm and OQ = 12 cm. By the Pythagorean theorem, PQ = √(OQ² - OP²) = √(12² - 5²) = √(144 - 25) = √119 cm.

question_text: Draw a circle and two lines parallel to a given line such that one is a tangent and the other, a secant to the circle.
correct_answer: A correct construction will show a circle with one line drawn tangent to it (touching it at exactly one point) and another line, parallel to a given reference line, which intersects the circle at two distinct points (a secant).
explanation: Step 1: Draw a circle using a compass. Step 2: Draw a given reference line. Step 3: To construct the tangent, select a point P on the circle and draw the radius OP. Then, at P, construct a line perpendicular to OP; this line is the tangent. Step 4: To construct the secant, draw a line parallel to the given reference line such that it cuts the circle at two distinct points. Label these intersection points to show it is a secant. The construction should clearly differentiate between the tangent (touching at only one point) and the secant (cutting through the circle).
